text:
Tobie:
Welcome to
"Just Roll With It!"
(upbeat theme song plays)
(kids cheering, screaming)

♪ Na na na na
na na na na ♪
It's about to go down!

-(bell ringing)
-(kids cheering)

♪ Na na na na
na na na na ♪
(audience cheering)

Byron (yelling):
Whoa! Yeah!

-Whoo!
-(clapping, cheering)
Hey!
Hey, everybody!

Welcome to
"Just Roll With It!"
(all cheering)

This show is taped
in front of a live
studio audience.

-You guys!
-(cheering)

But here's where
things are different.

You guys get to vote
on what happens
in each scene.

You've all been given remotes.
Let's see everybody's remote.

-Audience member: Woo!
-Suzi: Nice.
Thank you for the woo, yes.
Great.

-Ramon: Yeah.
-Now at some points
during the show,
you'll hear this sound.
(fog horn blaring)

And when you hear that,
three options will appear
on your screen.
(bell dings 3 times)

And you'll get to vote
to decide what happens
to us.
Go on. Vote!

Tobie: Now, we can't
see what's on the screens
right now,

so we have no idea
what you're voting on.

And we also have no idea
when in the scene
it's going to happen.

But your votes will be
instantly tallied.

And whatever you choose,
we'll have to...

All:
"Just Roll With It!"
(audience cheering)

-(bell dinging)
-(ping-pong balls pattering)
(Ramon laughing)

All right.
Are you guys excited?

-(audience cheering)
-Tobie:
Let's start the show.
(cheering continues)

♪ Na na na na
na na na na ♪
(Owen grunting)
(grunting)

-(grunts)
-(box clatters)
What are you doing?

I'm cataloging
Dad's old radio props

and getting a killer workout.
I call them "chore squats."

Think you can go squat
somewhere else?

No can do. I gotta keep
this booty lookin' good.

Searching. How to make
your brain forget the last
30 seconds forever.

At least I'm working.
You're supposed to be
taking out the garbage.

-I'm on it.
-Blair, let your big brother
give you some life advice

-on the things that--
-"A," you're my stepbrother.
"B," you don't have a life.

And "C," I don't need a "C"
'cause "B" was a pretty
sick burn.

How about "D,"
take out the trash.
Fine, I'm doing it.
(trash clattering)
(glass shatters)

Blair, you can't just
slap stamps

on a bag of garbage
and mail it.

Okay. Then you tell me
what just happened.

(laughing)
If you're just
tuning in with us,

we are speaking with
one of our favorite guests:

Miss California,
whose name is...
(inaudible)
Miss California!

Miss California:
Yes, Byron, I'm here to
answer questions
about my new school program.
Right.
The program that will...

get the kids...
to...
Eat bananas.

Miss California:
Well, yes. It provides
healthy lunches

to children
across the state.

Ah, yes, an appealing issue
that is ripe for our times.

I'm sure the students
will appreciate the fruits
of your labor.

We'll be right back
with this guest
after these messages.

Singers (on radio):
♪ Byron and Gator
in the morning ♪

Boom! That was like,
three fruit puns
in two sentences.

That has to be
a record.

Sweetie, you forgot
to hype the backstage
passes to Beyonce

we're giving away
next month.

Sorry, but The Gator overslept.
Without a co-host,

this morning's
been bananas.
(laughs)
Stop doing fruit puns.

Look, those tickets
equal ratings,

and as your general manager,
let me remind you

that nothing
is more important

than winning
the monthly radio ratings.

Nothing?
What about our children?

The children are
a close second.

-I'm gonna get that
stitched on a pillow.
-You're not funny.

I'm a little funny.
That's why you married me.

No, that's why
I hired you.

I married you so
I'd have one DJ

I didn't have to pay
as much as the others.

Wait! How much
are you paying The Gator?

-Blair, have you
finished your homework?
-Nope.

-And why not?
-Because I'm
watching videos

of circus clowns
getting attacked
by animals.

Blair, I don't want you
watching videos of people
getting hurt.

They're not people, Mom.
They're clowns.

-Blair, as your older brother--
-You're only one week
older than me.
Yeah, but I skipped a grade,

so even though I have
the body of a sixth grader,

I have the mind
of a seventh grader.
No, you don't.

You're right.
What sixth grader
has washboard abs,

and can open a soda bottle
just by flexing his
butt muscles?
(spits)

Please tell me
that's not how
you opened this.

Ask yourself,
have I ever offered you
a soda with the cap on?
Ahem.
Ta-da!
What is that?

It's my career day
presentation to your class.
I made a photo collage

chronicling my journey
from 20 years in the military

to being the manager
of BEATZ 101.

Mom, I need
"wow" factor.

Last year,
Becky Sparx's mom

brought free frozen yogurt
for the entire class!

I need to beat Becky Sparx
and win career day!

I don't think career day
is a competition.

Both:
Everything's a competition!

The Gator is still not here,
and I need a psychic
for the next segment now.

Dad, I can't be
on the radio!

I have no formal
radio training.

I hate to break it to you,
but deep down,

I'm not the cool, calm,
collected guy you think I am.

My ears are ringing.
There's a tightness
in my chest.

My life is flashing
before my eyes.

Your wedding
was beautiful, by the way.

Relax, buddy.
Nobody's forcing you
on the air.

Thanks. Last time Dad
put me on the radio,

I froze up and started
stress crying.

Took me a year
to lose the nickname
"Lil Wah Wah."

-I'll go on the air.
-Great! Come on.

-So, what are we doing?
-Oh.
(fog horn sounds)
(audience cheering)

Host:
Okay, audience.

You see your choices:
one, two, or three.

You guys vote on
what you want to
have happen next.

Our actors are leaving
the stage so we can
prepare your choice.
Lock in your vote.
First one just happened.

-We're ready.
Let's go.
-We're ready.

Okay, you gotta see
the handshake
and everything.

-Host: Okay, that's it.
Votes are in.
-(bell rings)
Let's go back to the scene.

Director:
And, action.

-So, what are we doing?
-Oh, you're gonna
love this.

These are the Beyonce tickets
I forgot to-- Hey.
(laughs)
Thank you.
Let's check this out.

As you know,
on Thursdays we play

-"Breakfast Barf Bonanza."
-(bell dings 3 times)

This is a game
where my daughter

will make the
grossest meal she can,

and I have to
actually eat it.

The ingredients
are on this tray
right here.
(audience cheering)

Blair:
We have mayonnaise,
lima beans,

uh, we have
jalapeno peppers.

-What is that?
-Gefilte fish.

Oysters, and crispy
grasshoppers.

Byron:
Okay, you gotta make it.

You're gonna make this.
Let's go, let's go with it.

-Byron: Lima beans.
-Mm-hmm.

-Is that ma--
Is that mayo?
-Yep!

Byron:
Oh, that's mayo!
Aah! Ha ha!

-Grasshoppers look good.
-Grasshoppers.
Ooh, some fish.

Oh, how about some oysters?
That looks yummy!
Yes!
Aah, yeah. Ooh!
Make it spicy.
Oh! (laughs)

I actually had a
grasshopper burrito
yesterday, so...

Yeah, well, you're gonna
have another one today.
Sorry.
Not sorry.
Great.

Anything for
my listeners, baby.

-Oh!
-Audience: Ew!

Audience:
Oh!
(laughing)
Low key, this is kinda good.

The oyster sets it off
a little bit in the back
of my throat, but...

-It's kind of good.
-(phone rings)

Hold on,
let's take a caller.
(laughs)

-Caller on phone:
Hey, Byron.
-Hello!

Caller:
I'm-- I'm loving this game,

but it seems really unfair
that the, uh...

little girl doesn't
have to eat something.

Audience:
Oh!

Caller:
I think it's time you made
something delicious for her.
(audience cheering)
Where did she come from?
(Blair laughing)

Blair (pleading):
Oh, please!

Byron:
See what we got here.
Okay.
Baked beans. Diced onions.

-Well, okay.
-Gummy worms.
(laughing)

Hot dog juice.
Ugh. And...
sardines.
(retching noise)

I told you to be nice.
So now, you're gonna pay.

Oh, really?
Seriously?

Byron:
I'm gonna help you out
a little bit with this.
Oh! Ha, ha!

The vanilla ice cream
and sardines is
gonna go well together.
Go eat. Go eat.
Here it goes.
(audience laughing)

-(Byron laughing)
-(audience cheering)

Caller:
Hey, Byron. Byron,
I'm still on the line.

Oh, you're still
on the line.
Oh, hey!

Caller:
Yeah. You know what?
You can't end the segment

without singing the
"Breakfast Barf Bonanza"
jingle.

The breakfast--
Oh, yeah!

- Yeah, you guys gotta
sing that jingle.
-I love that song.
Okay.

-♪ Breakfast bonanza ♪
-♪ Breakfast, uh, bonanza ♪

-Byron:
♪ Breakfast barf bonanza ♪
-Blair: ♪ Banana ♪

-♪ We got grasshoppers ♪
-♪ Woo, yeah, grasshoppers ♪

-♪ Fish and juice ♪
-♪ Fish and juice ♪

-♪ And when we in it
we love you ♪
-♪ And when we... ♪

-♪ We don't make it
do what it do ♪
-♪ We don't make it ♪
♪ Do what it do ♪
(audience cheering)

-And we're out.
-(clicks button)
That's, uh...
That was great!

We're out.
Uh, ah, great job.

By the way,
sorry I upstaged you.

Don't be. I can't believe
you got on the mic and
didn't start stress crying.
Come on.

-Never give me
sardines again!
-(Byron laughs)

(imitating Byron):
I can't believe
you got on the mic

and didn't start
stress crying.

Do I sense
a little jealousy?

Why? Because my little
step-sister is becoming
my father's favorite kid?
Owen, we have no favorites.

I knew it!
Dad married you
just to get to Blair.

He knew she'd be
a great co-host,

so he concocted this
whole sham marriage
just to get her on board.

It never made sense.
He's a freewheeling maniac,

and you're a
by-the-books army lady.

Next thing you know,
Blair's living on Easy Street,

while I'm shipped off
to Antarctica
to boarding school.

Our school bus
hits a snow drift,

I get attacked
by a polar bear,

-and all they ever find
of me is my tennis shoes.
-Owen!

You're doing that thing
that got us kicked off
that airplane again.

Look, just because
your father and Blair
have similar interests

doesn't mean
he doesn't love you.

Nobody's replacing
anybody.

Mom, you don't have
to come to Career Day
anymore.

-I asked Byron instead.
-Both: What?
I was right!
(techno music plays)
(audience cheering)

-Found some old pictures.
-Yeah, what's with
the Byron shrine?

Oh, I'm just
putting out some photos

of all the good times
Dad and I have had.

Just to remind him that...
I'm his son.

Check this out.
It's Dad and me riding bikes
when I was five years old.

Those training wheels
are so adorable.

Yeah. Dad's never
been good at riding bikes.

That's right,
Conner2007,
I am on your team,
but I got you anyway.

What are you
gonna do about it,
you little punk?

Your mom's been
playing that video game
for, like, four hours.

Yeah. That's what she does
when she's made at me.

Gotta say, picking my dad
over your mom for Career Day

might be what's
making your mom upset.

Maybe you should
talk to her about it.

Mom and I
are not so good
at talking about...
Feelings?
Bingo.

We have other ways
of dealing with
our emotions.

Aha! I got a tank now,
you little twerps!
Eat! Tank!

Anyway, I'm gonna go
take this garbage out
to the mailbox.

(lasers firing
on video game)

Hey.
(chuckles)
Rachel.

Seems like you're
just attacking
your own teammates.

I'm teaching them
a valuable lesson,
Owen.

You can never
trust anybody.

Including your own
daughter.

Do I sense
a little jealousy

that Blair picked
my dad over you?
Maybe a little bit.

Look, I know the most
important thing is for
my little girl to...

crush all the other
little girls in her class.
I...

I just wish she wanted
to crush them with me.
Here. Put these on.

A little workout
always helps me
relieve tension.

I'm mean, I'm glad
she gets along with
her new step-dad, but...

I don't want to suddenly be
the not-fun parent.

Don't be silly, Rachel.
It wasn't sudden.

According to Blair,
you've always been not fun.
What? You see?

I'm tired of everyone
seeing me as some
sort of buzzkill

who just nags everyone
all the time.
And I'm also tired of Byron

not hyping the Beyonce
tickets enough,

no matter how many times
I nag him about it.

I know!
Those tickets equal ratings!

-Exactly! You get it.
-Ow.

-I get it.
-Ow.

-Why doesn't
anyone else get it?
-Ow.

-I'm cool. I'm fun!
-Ow. Ow.
I know how to dab.

♪ Dabbin'
on my haters ♪

-Rachel?
-Mm?

Please promise me
you'll never do that again.
Sorry.

But, you know,
I think I'm realizing
this...

Career Day thing is
bothering me more
than I thought it was.

Maybe I actually do need
to talk to Blair about, um...
about how I, um...

-How I...
-Feel?

-Yes. That thing.
-Byron: Hey, guys.

Found one of
my old radio props

while I was hunting
for stuff for Blair's
Career Day.
Isn't it awesome?

It's a catapult.
The Gator and I used this

last Thanksgiving
to play Frozen
Turkey Dodgeball.

I thought I told you
to throw this thing away.
You did, but funny story:
I didn't.
Well, I really don't think

this is a good idea
for career day.
I know you don't.

Which is how I know
it's going to be awesome.

What is that
supposed to mean?

Blair, I think you should
listen to your mom here.
She's the responsible parent.
What is that supposed to mean?

-It's a fact!
You're irresponsible.
-Rachel: It is a fact.

-(all arguing)
-Guys!

Guys!
Aah, everybody relax!

-It's going to be safe.
-(catapult clatters)

-(Byron yells)
-(ceiling crumbling)

-Oops!
-Just great, Blair.

Now there's a giant hole
in our roof.

We're exposed
to the elements.
Lightning could strike us.

Raccoons could crawl in
and bite us.

Our plants could get
too much sun!

-(foghorn blows)
-Oh, gosh!
(audience cheering)

-Be nice! Be nice!
-Be nice!
Don't make me eat oysters!

Host: Okay, audience.
Our actors have left
the stage.

Here are your three choices.
It's time to lock in your vote.
Just roll with it!

Ramon:
Man, I want to see what's
gonna happen to me.

-Tobie: Let's do this!
-(bell rings)

Host:
Okay, votes are in.
Now, back to the scene.

Director:
And, action!

Just great, Blair.
Now there's a giant hole
in our roof.

We're exposed to the elements.
Lightning could strike us.

Raccoons could
crawl in and bite us.

Our plants could get
too much sun!

Owen, raccoons coming
through the roof
would be ridiculous.
(man screaming)

-(thudding)
-(Blair shrieks)

-(audience laughing)
-(man grunting)

-Ho!
-(bell dinging)
Ho!

-Owen: Are you okay, dude?
-(Byron laughing)

Heh. I'm the roofer,
by the way.

Good news is,
I cleared out
all your gutters.

Bad news is,
I think I found
a hole in your roof.

-Yeah.
-Byron: Thank you.

-Thank you.
-Uh, yeah, thank you
for that.

Oh, but, uh...
I should mention, uh...

I think the reason that
your gutters are all
messed up is because I, uh,

I saw a big old
bunch of birds
build a nest up there.
Just so you know.

-(splattering)
-(audience laughs)
(bell dings 3 times)

Owen, that's supposed
to be good luck.
It doesn't taste like it.

Well, great.
Just great.

Now I've got to move
all my pictures so they
don't get messed up.

You see, Blair?
You see how your actions
affect other people?

-(liquid pouring)
-(Owen sobbing)
I'm lucky today!
(audience laughing)
That is a big hole.

-(splattering)
-(audience laughing)
That is a big bird.
(audience laughing)

Uh, I think Mom is right, Blair.
No catapult.

We'll have to
think of something else.

Thank you. Getting this
"dumbest idea ever"
outta here.
That's not true.

I've had a ton more
dumber ideas than this.
So, Blair...

Blairski.
My daughter.
(laughs)

Maybe you and I
should have a little...
talk.

-Oh, boy.
-N-- I know. I know.
I don't like it, either.

So, I realize that
not going to Career Day
has made me...
You know.

-What?
-Well...
It's sort of...

When you...
It-- It didn't...
Never mind.

-Cool.
-Good talk.
(audience cheering)

♪ Na na na na
na na na na ♪

Mrs. Sparx:
And that's my presentation.

Now, "froyo" hands up
and enjoy your free yogurt!
(kids cheering)

-Well, this is awkward.
-Why?

These used to be
my classmates before
I skipped a grade.

Did I mention
I skipped a grade?

-Two seconds ago.
-Mom, you came.

'Course. Everyone
needs reinforcements.

How are the
presentations going?

Not great.
Everyone loses their mind
over free froyo.

Can I get cookie crumbles
and sprinkles on mine?
Of course.

Becky Sparx
is a legend!
(class clapping, cheering)

Okay, class.
Our next presentation
will be from Blair

and her step-father.
Fun!

-Rachel: Yay!
-(class cheers)

When my mom
started dating again,

I was afraid
she was going to marry
some dweeby, gangly nerdo.

Huh. Nope.
But it wasn't for
a lack of trying.
(laughs)

But I lucked out.
Because my new step-dad
is awesome.

You probably know him
from all the crazy stunts
he does

as the morning DJ
on BEATZ 101:

-Byron Blatt!
-(class applauding)

How would you guys
like to be part of a live
radio broadcast?
(class cheering)

We're going live in
five, four, three, two...

Singers (on radio):
♪ Byron and Blair
in the classroom ♪

Good morning,
everybody out there
in radio land.

I'm coming to you live
from my step-daughter's
classroom.
Isn't that right, kids?
(class cheering)

Maybe we were wrong.
Maybe this won't be
a disaster.

Blair, tell our listeners
what we have planned.

We're going to break
the world record

for office chair revolutions
propelled by a leaf blower.
(class cheering)

Scratch that.
Here comes the disaster.

Okay. Now, so I'm gonna
turn this leaf blower
all the way up to five.

Yeah, five seems
like a mistake.

You're right.
Five does seem
like a mistake.

'Cause this sucker
goes all the way
up to ten.
Let's do ten!

Class (chanting):
Let's do ten!

Audience (chanting):
Let's do ten!
Let's do ten!

All right. Here we go.
Blair.

Tell our listeners
what's happening.

-(foghorn blares)
-(audience cheers)
(bell dings 3 times)

Host:
Okay, everyone.
It's that time again.
Vote for your choice.

Heading back, guys.
What do you have
planned for us?

Something's gonna happen
to Rachel or Byron

because nothing's happened
to Rachel. I'm paranoid now.

-Where are we going from?
-Man: We're gonna start from

-your line.
-All right, here we go.

-(bell rings)
-Host:
And now back to the scene.

Director:
And, action!

Here we go, now.
Blair, tell our listeners
what's happening.

-(whirring)
-This one's for
the history books.

He's going around.
He's going around again.

I'm not sure
what else to say here,

because he just
keeps going around.

-And again.
-Whoa!

-(crashing)
-(clattering)

-(spraying)
-(class screaming)

-(bell dings 3 times)
-(audience laughing,
screaming)

Byron:
I'll save you!
My daughter!
(screaming continues)

-I'll save you!
-(Owen laughing)
I am so sorry.
(Owen laughing)

Please do not blame Blair.
This is all my fault.

I just got so caught up
with trying to entertain you
and your amazing class.

No one's on the mic.
This is dead air.

Someone has to do something.
The show must go on.

Uh, hello, everyone.
My name's Owen.

But you listeners
may know me as
"Lil Wah Wah."

We-we may not have broken
the record today,

but everyone
in this classroom
was part of an event

that they'll remember
their entire lives.
"Lil Wah Wah" out!

We'll remember it
because it was a disaster!

Well, would it make up
for that disaster if
everyone here

got backstage passes
to the Beyonce concert
next month?
(class cheering)
Excuse me. (laughs)

Owen, I don't have
those tickets with me.

Yes, you do, because
I put 'em in your purse
this morning.
Oh. So you did.

Well, I see why
you skipped sixth grade.
What do you say, Rachel?
Well...
I am the fun mom.
So, um...

Everyone's going
to Beyonce.
(class cheering)

I can't believe it.
I'm gonna meet Queen Bey!

Mom, I can't believe
you did that for me.

You needed those
tickets to win
the monthly radio ratings.
Yeah, well...

you know, some things
are a little more
important than winning.
(laughs)

Wow, Mom.
That's surprisingly
un-Mom of you.

Thank you, Blair.
I'm trying.

Thank you so much
for these tickets.

You have no idea
what a terrible month
I've been having.

Someone keeps mailing
garbage to my house.
(audience cheering)

-(crickets chirping)
-(door opens)

I have a feeling
we'll be talking about
that presentation
for years to come.
Yeah, in court.

Who cares?
We trashed the dump,

and then sent everyone
to meet Beyonce.

You were right, Mom.
That was so much better
than the catapult.
Speaking of which, Dad,

I thought you were gonna
get that roof hole fixed.
I'm working on it.

I called the
construction company

to come and take
a look at the hole
while we were out.
(phone rings)
Oh, that's them.

-(foghorn blasts)
-Aw, really?
(audience cheers)

Have you not
had enough?

-Host: Okay, this is
the last vote.
-(bell dings 3 times)

Host:
Make it count.
Lock in your choices.

So, whatever happens
in this one,

when you finally
get to your group hug,
as carefully as possible,

exit the set
the way you came,

and go on up in the audience
and say hi to everybody.

Host:
And let's go back
to the scene.

Director:
And, action!

I called the
construction company

to come and take
a look at the hole
while we were out.
(phone rings)

-Rachel: Oh!
-Oh, that's them.
Hello?

Man (on phone): Hey,
Byron, this is the, uh,
construction company.
We got some bad news.

We made a mistake
and accidentally scheduled
your home to be demolished.

Uh, we tried to contact
our guy and tell him he had
the wrong house,

but we haven't
heard back from him yet,
so...

-(exploding)
-Audience: Ooh!
(bell rings 3 times)

-(creaking)
-(Blair screaming)
(audience laughing)

Oh, my gosh!
Our house!

-Remember when you told me
I had to get insurance?
-Rachel: It's all right.

Funny story:
I didn't.

Byron:
Uh...

Why do I think this is
the perfect time to tell you,

I've been thinking
we should move.
Blair!

Owen,
I just want to tell you
how proud I am of you.

When you got on
that mic today,
you were fearless.

And you saved
my presentation!

What can I say?
I gotta look out
for you, Blair.

After all, I am
your older step-brother.

Blair:
Oh, gosh. Oh!

-It's easier
just to say "brother."
-(Byron yells)
